definition: A supernatural being of Germanic mythology, typically depicted as a small, elusive figure
A circular band worn as an ornament or a symbol of authority or membership
A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt, used for thrusting or striking
An undead creature in Norse mythology, often associated with burial mounds
A member of a mythical race of short, stout beings who are skilled in mining and metalworking
A bird of prey with keen eyesight, a hooked beak, and powerful talons
A large, hoofed mammal of the family Equidae, domesticated since ancient times
A protective head covering, typically made of metal or leather
A large, black bird known for its intelligence and distinctive call
A male ruler of a kingdom; a monarch
A nobleman ranking below a king but above a thane or a chieftain
A large snake, especially a mythical one
A carnivorous mammal of the dog family, known for its pack behavior and howling
A seafaring warrior and explorer from the late 8th to early 11th centuries
A small watercraft used for transportation or leisure
A long pole weapon with a sharp pointed head, used for thrusting or throwing
An adult human male
A person who steals or commits theft
A series of thoughts, images, or emotions that occur during sleep
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins
Any nutritious substance that is eaten, drunk, or otherwise taken into the body to sustain life
The opening through which food passes into the body and vocal sounds are emitted
A food made from the pressed curds of milk, often seasoned and aged
Porridge
Hat
Knife
Fire
Waterfall
City, fence
Mound, burial mound
World, country
Islet, small island
Forest
Meadow
Wolf
Bay
Path, road
A hole or excavation in the ground from which water springs.
examples: Ég fylli búnaðinn við vatn úr brunninum. (I fill the equipment with water from the well.)

definition: The sharp or pointed end of something.
examples: Ólafur vissi ekki hvort hann myndi lifa til annars oddar dagsins. (Ólafur did not know if he would live until the end of the day.)

definition: A loose granular substance, typically found on beaches and in deserts.
examples: Ströndin er með gylltan sand. (The beach has golden sand.)

definition: The perceptible natural movement of the air.
examples: Vindrinn blæs sterkt í dag. (The wind is blowing strongly today.)

definition: Referring to a person who has authority, control, or power over others.
examples: Dróttinn ræðr öllu. (The Lord rules all.)

definition: Referring to a person who behaves dishonestly or unethically.
examples: Níðingr stal fénu. (The scoundrel stole the money.)

definition: Referring to a person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.
examples: Þræll vinnur á akri. (The slave works in the field.)

definition: A member of the principal pantheon in Norse religion; a deity.
examples: Áss er dýrkaður. (The god is worshiped.)

definition: A tool with a heavy metal head used for breaking things or driving in nails.
examples: Hamarr er í húsi. (The hammer is in the house.)

definition: The expanse of air over the Earth; the celestial abode of divine beings.
examples: Himinn er blár. (The sky is blue.)

definition: A naturally raised area of land, smaller than a mountain.
examples: Hóll er grænn. (The hill is green.)

definition: Frozen water, a brittle, transparent crystalline solid.
examples: Íss er kaldur. (The ice is cold.)

definition: A mythological being in Norse mythology, often opposed to the gods.
examples: Jötunn er stór. (The giant is big.)

definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, or snow.
examples: Stormr er ógnandi. (The storm is threatening.)

definition: A vehicle used for transporting goods or people, usually pulled by horses.
examples: Vagn er fullur af heyi. (The wagon is full of hay.)

definition: The hard fibrous material that forms the main substance of the trunk or branches of a tree; a large solid piece of wood.
examples: Viðr er í eldi. (The wood is in the fire.)

definition: The particular condition that someone or something is in at a specific time; the development of events beyond a person's control.
examples: Dómr hans er óljós. (His fate is uncertain.)

definition: A person who buys and sells goods, especially on a large scale.
examples: Kaupmaðr selur vörur. (The merchant sells goods.)

definition: A unit of currency; a piece of metal used as a medium of exchange.
examples: Hann hefur margar penningar. (He has many coins.)

definition: A male child or young man.
examples: Sveinn er glaður. (The boy is happy.)

definition: The state of being a slave; a condition of hard work and subjection.
examples: Þrældómr er óréttlátur. (Slavery is unjust.)

definition: A type of tree known for its hard wood, often used to make weapons; a spear made from the wood of an ash tree.
examples: Hann smíðar askr. (He crafts an ash wood spear.)

definition: A strong, fast, or high-spirited horse; a steed used in battle or for travel.
examples: Drasill er fljótr. (The steed is fast.)

definition: The ability to do something or act in a particular way; physical or mental strength.
examples: Hans máttr er ótrúlegur. (His power is incredible.)

definition: Compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone whom it is within one's power to punish or harm.
examples: Hann bað um grið. (He asked for mercy.)

definition: A large expanse of salt water, typically one of the world's main divisions.
examples: Haf er dýpt og óendanlegt. (The sea is deep and endless.)

definition: The action of buying something; an agreement between parties.
examples: Hann gerði gott kaup. (He made a good deal.)

definition: A nation or territory; the solid part of the earth's surface.
examples: Land mitt er fallegt. (My country is beautiful.)

definition: The direction in which a compass needle normally points, toward the horizon on the left side when one is facing east.
examples: Vindurinn blæs frá norðri. (The wind blows from the north.)

definition: Guidance or recommendations offered concerning prudent action; a conclusion or resolution.
examples: Hann gaf mér gott ráð. (He gave me good advice.)

definition: A particular position or point in space; a residence or home.
examples: Þetta er fallegur staðr. (This is a beautiful place.)

definition: The act of buying slaves or people for servitude.
examples: Hann gerði þrælakaup í borginni. (He made a slave purchase in the city.)

definition: Third-person singular masculine pronoun
First-person singular pronoun
examples: Ek heiti John.
Ég elska þig.

definition: Second-person singular pronoun
examples: þú ert vinur minn.
Þú kemur seinna.

russianTranslation: тот, этот / та, эта / то, это
definition: That, it
All, whole
Many
Some, certain
Referring to two entities together.
examples: Báðir menn ganga til veizlu. (Both men are going to the feast.)

definition: Asking about something or expressing surprise.
examples: Hvat heitir þetta? (What is this called?)
Hvat! (What! How! Surprising!)

definition: Referring to one of two entities.
examples: Annarr maðr gekk heim. (One of the two men went home.)

definition: Referring to none or nobody.
examples: Engi maðr kom. (No man came.)

definition: Referring to that specific entity or another.
examples: Hinn maðr er hér. (That man is here.)

russianTranslation: кто / то / та, каждый / каждое / каждая
definition: Referring to who or each one.
examples: Hverr maðr skal fara? (Who shall go?)

definition: Referring to oneself.
examples: Hann sá sik í spegli. (He saw himself in the mirror.)

definition: Referring to such or of that kind.
examples: Slíkr maðr er góðr. (Such a man is good.)

definition: Referring to the person or thing in question as the same as the one previously mentioned.
examples: Hann sjálfr gerði það. (He himself did it.)

russianTranslation: тот / то / та, этот / это / эта, оно
definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker.
examples: Sá maðr er góður. (That man is good.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker.
examples: Þetta er minn bók. (This is my book.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker and one other person.
examples: Þetta er okkarr hús. (This is our house.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with a previously mentioned person or thing.
examples: Hann fann sinn hatt. (He found his hat.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more other people.
examples: Þetta er várr bíll. (This is our car.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er yðvarr peningur. (This is your money.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the two people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er ykkarr borð. (This is your table.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er þinn hundur. (This is your dog.)

russianTranslation: кто (из двух), который (из двух), каждый (из двух)
definition: Used to refer to one or the other of two people or things.
examples: Hvárr þeirra er sterkari? (Which of the two is stronger?)

definition: Negative particle, indicating negation or denial
examples: Hann kemur eigi.
Þau vilja eigi fara.

definition: Adverb indicating location, referring to the current place or position
examples: Hann er hér.
Þau búa hér.

definition: Adverb indicating addition or inclusion, used to connect and emphasize similar ideas
examples: Hún er góð ok.
Þau vilja fara ok.

definition: At the present time; at this moment
Very
Therefore
Soon
Often
To or at the place where one lives.
examples: Hann fer heim. (He goes home.)

definition: To a greater degree; more preferable or suitable.
examples: Hann vill heldr lesa. (He would rather read.)

definition: In addition; besides; up to a particular point, degree, or extent.
examples: Hann er til góður. (He is still good.)

definition: So, thus
Well, willingly
In a direction or manner that returns to a previous position or condition; once more.
examples: Hann fer aftr heim. (He goes back home.)

definition: From a particular place; out of existence or notice.
examples: Hann fer brott. (He goes away.)

definition: In a united or coordinated manner; in conjunction with others.
examples: Þau fara saman. (They go together.)

definition: At that time; at the time in question.
examples: Þá var hann ungur og óreyndur. (He was young and inexperienced then.)

definition: To or in what place or direction.
examples: Hvert ferðu? (Where are you going?)

definition: Over a great distance; from a distant place.
examples: Hann kom langt í burtu. (He came from far away.)

definition: For a considerable duration; for an extended period.
examples: Hann bíðaði lengi. (He waited for a long time.)

definition: Toward or in the northern part or direction.
examples: Hann fer norðr. (He goes northward.)

definition: Toward or in the western part or direction.
examples: Sólin setur vestr. (The sun sets in the west.)

definition: From that place; in the direction away from that location.
examples: Hann kom þaðan. (He came from there.)

definition: Conjunction used to introduce a contrasting or comparative clause
examples: Hann er kaldur en þú ert heitur.
Þau vilja fara, en ég vil ekki.

definition: Relates to the word 'which' or 'when'
examples: Bókin er góð, er er skrifuð á ensku.
Hann kom í bókasafnið er það var að loka.

definition: That
Because
Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences that are to be taken jointly.
examples: Hann er bæði góður ok hreinn. (He is both good and pure.)

definition: Used to introduce a further negative statement; not either.
examples: Hann er eigi gamall né ungur. (He is neither old nor young.)

definition: If, in case
While, as long as
As, like
As, just as

examples: Já, ég vil fara í bókasafnið.
Hún spurði hvort ég hef lesið þessa bók, og ég sagði já.
Nei, ég er ekki viss um það.
Hann spurði hvort ég gæti hjálpað honum, en ég sagði nei.

definition: Greetings, hello
Or
In, on
With
Expressing location or time, often with the sense of being in contact with or attached to something.
examples: Hann sat á stólinum. (He sat on the chair.)

definition: Indicating movement from a place or the point of origin of something.
examples: Hann kom úr húsinu. (He came out of the house.)

definition: In opposition to; as a substitute or equivalent.
examples: Hann er gegn mér. (He is against me.)

definition: Expressing motion in the direction of; indicating the purpose or goal.
examples: Hann fer til bæjar. (He goes to the town.)

definition: Expressing the point in space at which a journey, motion, or action starts; indicating separation or removal.
examples: Hann fer af bænum. (He goes from the town.)

definition: In the vicinity of; close to.
examples: Hann stendur hjá húsi. (He stands by the house.)

definition: Indicating movement in an area; concerning or regarding.
examples: Hann gengur um torgið. (He walks around the square.)

definition: At or to a short distance away from; in the company of; in relation to.
examples: Hann situr við eldinn. (He sits by the fire.)

definition: Extending or directly above; from one side to the other; in or to a position above or higher than.
examples: Hann fer yfir brúna. (He goes over the bridge.)

definition: In the midst of; surrounded by; in the interval or space separating two points.
examples: Hann er meðal vina. (He is among friends.)

definition: In a position below or lower than something else, typically denoting a place or location.
examples: Hann situr undir trénu. (He sits under the tree.)

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'vera' (to be)
examples: Hann er góður vinur.
Þau eru góð börn.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'eiga' (to own, to possess)
examples: Hann á hest.
Hún á hús.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'hafa' (to have)
examples: Hún hefir bók.
Þau hefir hund.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'heita' (to be called)
examples: Hann heitir Ólafur.
Þau heita Guðrún og Jón.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'segja' (to say)
examples: Hann segir bless.
Hún segir já.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'sjá' (to see)
examples: Hún sér blómin.
Þau sér fugl.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'taka' (to take)
examples: Hann tekr bók.
Hún tekr blómin.

definition: Third-person singular present indicative of the verb 'vegja' (to kill, to attack)
examples: Hann vegr dreka.
Hún vegr hund.

definition: Third-person singular present tense form of the verb 'vilia' (to want)
examples: Hann vill fara í bókasafn.
Hún vill borða köku.

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'bíða' (to wait, to wait for)
Infinitive form of the verb 'deyja' (to die)
Infinitive form of the verb 'flýja' (to flee, to run away)
Infinitive form of the verb 'hata' (to hate)

russianTranslation: идти под парусами, плыть на судне
definition: To sail
To present something for acceptance or rejection; to command or direct someone to do something.
examples: Hann bauð mér að mæta í kvöld. (He invited me to come tonight.)

definition: To expel air or any other substance from the mouth.
examples: Blása í eldinn til að kveikja í honum. (Blow into the fire to kindle it.)

definition: To be in or maintain an upright position; to continue to exist, endure, or remain valid.
examples: Hún stendur upp og gengur út. (She stands up and goes outside.)

definition: To make something visible or evident to the eyes or other senses.
examples: Hann sýnir mér gamla myntasafn sitt. (He shows me his old coin collection.)

definition: To perform an action or activity; to execute or carry out.
examples: Hann gørir verkið. (He does the work.)

definition: To guide or direct in a particular direction; to accompany someone to ensure they reach a destination.
examples: Hann leiðir mig heim. (He leads me home.)

definition: To have in mind as a purpose or goal.
examples: Hann mun fara á morgun. (He intends to go tomorrow.)

definition: To compel to move in a particular direction; to exert force upon.
examples: Hann rek kúna. (He drives the cows.)

definition: To be under a moral or legal obligation to do something.
examples: Hann skal borga mér. (He owes me.)

definition: To undergo a change or development; to come to be in a particular state or condition.
examples: Hann verður gamall. (He becomes old.)

definition: To operate and control the direction and speed of a motor vehicle; to travel on a horse or bicycle.
examples: Hann akar bíl. (He drives a car.)

definition: To consume fuel and give off heat, light, and gases; to set on fire.
examples: Hann brennir eld. (He burns fire.)

definition: To move through the air using wings; to travel in an aircraft.
examples: Hann flýgur með fuglum. (He flies with birds.)

definition: To give or provide assistance; to make it easier for someone to do something.
examples: Hann hjálpar mér. (He helps me.)

russianTranslation: сгибать в кольцо, сворачивать в кольца
definition: To form into a circular shape; to wind into continuous rings.
examples: Hann hringar snúru. (He coils the rope.)

definition: To propel a boat with oars; to move by means of oars.
examples: Hann roer á vatni. (He rows on the water.)

definition: To keep safe from harm or injury; to watch over and defend.
examples: Hann verndar hús. (He protects the house.)

definition: To give money to in return for goods or services rendered; to make reparation or compensation for.
examples: Hann gjaldar fyrir matinn. (He pays for the food.)

definition: To grasp, carry, or support with one's arms or hands; to keep possession of.
examples: Hann heldur bókinni. (He holds the book.)

englishTranslation: to buy, to make a deal
definition: To acquire in exchange for money or its equivalent; to enter into an agreement.
examples: Hann kaupir hest. (He buys a horse.)

definition: To try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly; to make an effort to do something.
examples: Hann leitar svara. (He searches for answers.)

definition: To communicate information, facts, or news to someone; to determine the total number of.
examples: Hann telur sögu. (He tells a story.)

definition: To accept something as true; to have confidence in the truth, existence, or reliability of something.
examples: Hann trúir þér. (He believes you.)

definition: To pick out or select as being the best or most appropriate of two or more alternatives.
examples: Hann velur vín. (He chooses wine.)

definition: To restore to health or soundness; to remedy or alleviate a disease or ailment.
examples: Hann læknaði sárin. (He healed the wounds.)

definition: To give a name to; to specify or refer to by name; to bring up or communicate.
examples: Hann nefndi það í bókinni. (He mentioned it in the book.)

definition: To move from a lower position to a higher one; to get up from a seated or lying position.
examples: Sól rís á morgun. (The sun rises in the morning.)

definition: To create or produce something by assembling or shaping parts or materials.
examples: Hann smíðaði skip. (He crafted a ship.)

englishTranslation: to know, to be oriented (towards something)
definition: To be aware of or familiar with; to have knowledge or information about; to be directed or facing in a particular direction.
examples: Hann veit ekki svarið. (He doesn't know the answer.)

englishTranslation: to lay, to set, to thrust
definition: To move to a horizontal position; to place in a particular position or location; to thrust or drive into a particular position.
examples: Hann leggur bókina á borðið. (He lays the book on the table.)

definition: To express gratitude or appreciation to someone.
examples: Hann þakkar þér fyrir hjálpina. (He thanks you for the help.)

definition: Beautiful, lovely
examples: Fagr maðr lifir í fegurð. (A beautiful person lives in beauty.)

definition: Good, kind
examples: Góðr verkr skapar gott karma. (Good work creates good karma.)

definition: Healthy, whole
examples: Heill maðr er heilbrigðr. (A healthy man is whole.)

definition: Bad, evil
examples: Illr hugr leiðir til ills verks. (A bad mind leads to a bad deed.)

definition: Cowardly, timid
examples: Ragr maðr flýr frá bardaga. (A cowardly man flees from battle.)

definition: Angry, furious
examples: Reiðr maðr talar harða. (An angry man speaks harshly.)

definition: Rich, mighty
examples: Ríkr maðr á marga gripi. (A rich man owns many treasures.)

definition: Small, little
examples: Smár fugl syngur í trénu. (A small bird sings in the tree.)

definition: Big, large
examples: Stórr hestur er öflugur. (A big horse is powerful.)

definition: Danish
examples: Danskr maðr talar Dönsku. (A Danish man speaks Danish.)

definition: Happy, joyful
examples: Glaðr maðr hlær. (A happy man laughs.)

definition: Hungry
examples: Svangr úlfur veiðir. (A hungry wolf hunts.)

definition: Black, dark
examples: Svartr hestr hleypur í nótt. (A black horse runs in the night.)

definition: Wide, broad
examples: Breiðr áin er erfitt að yfirfara. (The wide river is difficult to cross.)

definition: Deep
examples: Djúpr sjór hylur leyndardóma. (The deep sea hides mysteries.)

definition: Few, scarce
examples: Fáir menn vita sannleikann. (Few men know the truth.)

russianTranslation: близкий к смерти, обречённый на смерть
definition: Dying, doomed to die
examples: Feigr maðr er ekki hræddur við dauðann. (A doomed man is not afraid of death.)

definition: Golden, gilded
examples: Gylltr hringr glóir. (A gilded ring glows.)

definition: Clear, bright
examples: Heiðr himinn um sumar. (A clear sky in summer.)

definition: Long
examples: Langr vegur liggur framundan. (A long road lies ahead.)

definition: Norwegian
examples: Norskr maðr segir sögur. (A Norwegian man tells stories.)

definition: Having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
examples: Spakr maðr lærir af mistökum. (A wise man learns from mistakes.)

definition: Having great physical power or ability; marked by strength.
examples: Sterkr víkingr berst hart. (A strong Viking fights hard.)

definition: Having a considerable or great extent from side to side.
examples: Víðr völlur er góður fyrir leik. (A wide field is good for playing.)

definition: Radiating or reflecting light; luminous; shining.
examples: Bjartr stjarna á himninum. (A bright star in the sky.)

definition: In the early period of life, development, or growth.
examples: Ungr maður með framtíðardrauma. (A young man with dreams of the future.)

definition: Of the color between blue and yellow in the spectrum; colored like grass or emeralds.
examples: Groenn gras vaxa. (Green grass grows.)

definition: Relating to Ireland, its people, or the Irish language.
examples: Írskr maðr talar. (An Irish man speaks.)

definition: Recently made, grown, or developed; not old.
examples: Nýr dagr er kominn. (A new day has come.)

definition: Showing courage; ready to face and endure danger or pain.
examples: Djarfr maðr berst. (The brave man fights.)

definition: Having lived or existed for many years; of advanced age.
examples: Gamall maðr les. (The old man reads.)

definition: Having a surface free from irregularities, roughness, or projections; slick.
examples: Háll íss er hættulegur. (Smooth ice is dangerous.)

definition: Of or pertaining to the north, especially Northern Europe or Scandinavia.
examples: Norroenn tunga er flókin. (The northern language is complex.)

definition: Possessing complete or unlimited knowledge; all-wise.
examples: Hann er alvitr guð. (He is an all-knowing god.)

definition: Lacking the sense of sight; sightless.
examples: Blindr maðr fer með staf. (The blind man walks with a stick.)

definition: No longer alive; devoid of life.
examples: Dauðr fugl liggur á jörðinni. (A dead bird lies on the ground.)

definition: Having or giving off heat; having a high temperature.
examples: Heitr eldur brennur. (The hot fire burns.)

definition: Affected by physical or mental illness.
examples: Sjúkr maðr þarf lækningu. (The sick man needs treatment.)

definition: Having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
examples: Vitr maðr talar ekki ósanngjarnlega. (A wise man does not speak unjustly.)

definition: Dedicated to a religious purpose or deity; having a divine quality.
examples: Helgr staðr er friðr. (A holy place is peaceful.)

definition: Not good in quality or morally reprehensible.
examples: Vándr maðr ne skulu verða konungr. (An evil man should not become king.)

definition: Pleasing to the senses; aesthetically pleasing.
examples: Fríðr landskapr er augnayndi. (A beautiful landscape is a delight to the eyes.)

definition: Having a low temperature; lacking warmth.
examples: Kaldr vetrr bringr snjó. (A cold winter brings snow.)

definition: Large in size or extent; considerable.
examples: Mikill skipr er sterkari. (A big ship is stronger.)

definition: Having an attractive or endearing quality.
examples: Vænn barn gladdar hjarta. (A charming child gladdens the heart.)

definition: Known about by many people; celebrated.
examples: Frægr maðr lifir lengi. (A famous man lives long.)

definition: Having a fine edge or point; capable of cutting or piercing.
examples: Hvass sverðr er góðr vopn. (A sharp sword is a good weapon.)

definition: Strong, healthy, and full of energy.
examples: Röskr maðr vinnur mikið. (An energetic man achieves much.)

definition: Having or showing a sharp ability to think or understand.
examples: Skarpr hugr finnr lausnir. (A sharp mind finds solutions.)

definition: Able to be trusted or depended upon; firm and strong.
examples: Traustr vinr er bestur. (A reliable friend is the best.)

definition: Having great power, influence, or effect.
examples: Völdugr konungr ræðr ríki. (A powerful king rules the kingdom.)

definition: Having a mild and kind nature or disposition.
examples: Blíðr maðr er elskaðr af öllum. (A gentle man is loved by all.)

definition: Of a small length or duration; not long.
examples: Skammr dagr líðr hratt. (A short day passes quickly.)

definition: Showing signs of future success or good results.
examples: Efniligr unglingr verður ágætur maðr. (A promising youth becomes a great man.)

definition: Showing a lack of compassion or mercy; brutal.
examples: Grimmúðigr hershöfðingi ógnar óvinum. (A cruel commander terrifies enemies.)

definition: Having good fortune; marked by good luck or favorable circumstances.
examples: Heppinn maðr finnur gull. (A lucky man finds gold.)

definition: Having or showing courage and determination.
examples: Hugdjarfr drengur hræðist ekki. (A brave boy does not fear.)

definition: Not inhabited or populated; without inhabitants.
examples: Óbyggðr eyja er í hafinu. (An uninhabited island is in the sea.)

definition: Of the color at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet.
examples: Rauðr blómr er fallegur. (A red flower is beautiful.)

definition: Responsible for wrongdoing or a crime; legally culpable.
examples: Sekr maðr bíðr refsingar. (A guilty man awaits punishment.)

definition: Having a strong desire for success or achievement; having or showing power and authority.
examples: Stórráðr konungr breiðir ríki sitt. (An ambitious king expands his kingdom.)

definition: Very intense or extreme; showing deep insight or understanding.
examples: Djúpúðigr spekingr kennir margt. (A profound sage teaches much.)

definition: Preceding all others in time or order; earliest; 1st.
examples: Fyrstr maðr í röðinni. (The first man in line.)

definition: Having little flesh or fat on the body; slender.
examples: Magr hestur þarfnast fóðurs. (A thin horse needs feeding.)

definition: In the state of staying in one place or remaining inactive in expectation of something.
examples: Beðinn maðr við hliðið. (The man waiting by the gate.)

definition: Approaching death; gradually ceasing to be alive.
examples: Dáinn maðr í rúminu. (The dying man in bed.)

definition: Having ownership or control over something.
examples: Áttr maðr mikla auðæfi. (The man possessing great wealth.)

definition: Pursuing or following someone or something swiftly to catch them.
examples: Eltr hundur eftir héra. (The dog chasing after the deer.)

definition: In the act of consuming food.
examples: Etinn maðr við borðið. (The man eating at the table.)

definition: Running away from a place or situation of danger.
examples: Flýiðr börn frá eldi. (Children fleeing from the fire.)

definition: Possessing, holding, or owning something.
examples: Hafðr karl svörð. (The man having a sword.)

definition: Feeling intense or passionate dislike for someone or something.
examples: Hataðr maðr at öðrum. (The man hating another.)

definition: Being named or referred to.
examples: Heitinn staðr sem Eldborg. (The place called Eldborg.)

definition: Moving at a speed faster than a walk, never having both feet on the ground at the same time.
examples: Hlaupinn maðr í skóginum. (The man running in the forest.)

definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening harm or danger.
examples: Hræddr andlit í myrkrinu. (A frightening face in the darkness.)

definition: Crying out to attract attention; shouting.
examples: Kallaðr maðr eftir hjálp. (The man calling for help.)

definition: Aware of or familiar with through experience or information.
examples: Kenndr drengur um leyndarmál. (The boy knowing the secret.)

definition: Approaching or arriving at a place.
examples: Kominn gestr til húss. (The guest coming to the house.)

definition: Expressing thoughts, feelings, or information verbally.
examples: Mæltr maðr við þing. (The man speaking at the assembly.)

definition: Moving or arranging (a door or window) so as to allow access and visibility.
examples: Opnaðr gluggi í húsinu. (The window opening in the house.)

definition: Uttering or expressing words or phrases.
examples: Sagðr maðr frá sögum. (The man saying stories.)

definition: Perceiving with the eyes; looking at.
examples: Sénn vörður á turninum. (The guard seeing from the tower.)

definition: Laying hold of something with one's hands; reaching for and grasping.
examples: Tekinn maðr við verkfærum. (The man taking the tools.)

definition: Ceasing to sleep; becoming awake.
examples: Vaknaðr barn í morgun. (The child waking in the morning.)

definition: Causing the death of a living creature.
examples: Veginn úlfur í skóginum. (The wolf killing in the forest.)

definition: Existing; having existence or being.
examples: Verinn andi í húsinu. (The being in the house.)

definition: Ready, eager, or prepared to do something.
examples: Viljaðr maðr til að læra. (The man willing to learn.)

definition: Moving or traveling from one place to another.
examples: Farinn kaupmaðr til borgar. (The merchant going to the city.)

definition: Perceiving with the ear the sound made by someone or something.
examples: Heyrðr börn sögu. (The children hearing a story.)

definition: Saying something in order to obtain an answer or some information.
examples: Spurðr maðr um leiðina. (The man asking for directions.)

definition: Saying something in reply; responding to a question or statement.
examples: Svaraðr lærðr við spurningum. (The scholar answering questions.)

definition: Capturing or seizing something, especially after pursuit.
examples: Veiddr fiskimaðr í ánni. (The fisherman catching in the river.)

definition: Discovering something by chance or deliberately after searching.
examples: Fundinn drengur gullhring. (The boy finding a gold ring.)

definition: Taking or carrying someone or something to a place.
examples: Foerðr maðr mat til borðs. (The man bringing food to the table.)

definition: Presenting voluntarily without expecting compensation.
examples: Gefinn karl gjafir til barna. (The man giving gifts to children.)

definition: Making the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement.
examples: Hleginn maðr við brandara. (The man laughing at a joke.)

definition: Being consumed by fire; aflame.
examples: Brunninn bál á fjöllunum. (The burning bonfire in the mountains.)

definition: Residing or existing; inhabiting a place.
examples: Búinn maðr í litlu húsi. (The man living in a small house.)

definition: Preparing food for eating especially by applying heat; providing fuel or energy.
examples: Eldaðr kokkur í eldhúsinu. (The cook cooking in the kitchen.)

definition: Moving downward, typically rapidly and freely without control, from a higher to a lower level.
examples: Fallinn lauf á haustin. (The leaves falling in autumn.)

definition: Moving forward on foot at a steady pace; traveling by foot.
examples: Genginn maðr um götu. (The man walking down the street.)

definition: Having life; being alive; not dead.
examples: Lifaðr fiskur í vatninu. (The living fish in the water.)

definition: Traveling in a ship or boat using sails, especially as a sport or recreation.
examples: Siglðr skip á hafi. (The ship sailing on the sea.)

definition: Having been presented for acceptance or rejection; having been commanded or directed.
examples: Boðinn aðstoðar af öryggismönnum, lést hann aldrei. (Offered assistance by security personnel, he never died.)

definition: Currently expelling air or any other substance from the mouth.
examples: Blásinn af vindinum, lék hann með drifinu. (Blowing with the wind, he played with the kite.)

definition: Currently being in or maintaining an upright position.
examples: Staðinn á hávaðanum, horfði hann yfir landið. (Standing on the cliff, he looked over the land.)

definition: Currently making something visible or evident to the eyes or other senses.
examples: Sýndr af listum sínum, fékk hann áhrifin með tónlist sinni. (Showing his skills, he influenced the audience with his music.)

definition: Engaged in performing or executing a particular action.
examples: Gørðr maðr vinnur. (The doing man works.)

definition: Guiding or directing in a particular direction; accompanying someone.
examples: Leiddr maðr fer. (The leading man goes.)

definition: Having in mind as a purpose or goal; planning.
examples: Munaðr maðr bíður. (The intending man waits.)

definition: Compelling to move in a particular direction; exerting force upon.
examples: Rekinn maðr stýrir. (The driving man steers.)

definition: Under a moral or legal obligation to do something; obliged.
examples: Skulaðr maðr greiðir. (The owing man pays.)

definition: Undergoing a change or development; coming to be in a particular state or condition.
examples: Orðinn maðr hlýðir. (The becoming man listens.)

definition: Engaged in operating and controlling the direction and speed of a motor vehicle; traveling on a horse or bicycle.
examples: Ekinn maðr fer. (The driving man goes.)

definition: Moving through the air using wings; traveling in an aircraft.
examples: Floginn fugl syngur. (The flying bird sings.)

definition: Giving or providing assistance; making it easier for someone to do something.
examples: Hólpinn bróðir smíðar. (The helping brother builds.)

definition: Forming into a circular shape; winding into continuous rings.
examples: Hringaðr maðr bindur. (The coiling man ties.)

definition: Propelling a boat with oars; moving by means of oars.
examples: Róinn maðr fer. (The rowing man goes.)

definition: Keeping safe from harm or injury; watching over and defending.
examples: Verndaðr maðr vakir. (The protecting man watches.)

definition: Giving money to in return for goods or services rendered.
examples: Goldinn maðr er áreiðanlegur. (The paying man is reliable.)

definition: Grasping, carrying, or supporting with one's arms or hands.
examples: Haldinn sveinn les. (The holding boy reads.)

definition: Acquiring in exchange for money or its equivalent.
examples: Keyptr maðr fer til markaðar. (The buying man goes to the market.)

definition: Trying to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly; making an effort to do something.
examples: Leitaðr maðr finnur. (The searching man finds.)

definition: Communicating information, facts, or news; determining the total number of.
examples: Taliðr maðr hlýðir. (The telling man listens.)

definition: Accepting something as true; having confidence in the truth, existence, or reliability of something.
examples: Trúaðr maðr fylgir. (The believing man follows.)

definition: Picking out or selecting as being the best or most appropriate of two or more alternatives.
examples: Valiðr maðr smakkar. (The choosing man tastes.)

definition: Restoring to health or soundness; remedying or alleviating a disease or ailment.
examples: Læknaðr maðr hjálpar öðrum. (The healing man helps others.)

definition: Giving a name to; specifying or referring to by name; bringing up or communicating.
examples: Nefndr nafn er frægt. (The mentioned name is famous.)

definition: Moving from a lower position to a higher one; getting up from a seated or lying position.
examples: Risinn maðr sér betur. (The rising man sees better.)

definition: Creating or producing something by assembling or shaping parts or materials.
examples: Smíðaðr hlutur er fallegur. (The crafted object is beautiful.)

definition: Being aware of or familiar with; having knowledge or information about; being directed or facing in a particular direction.
examples: Vitaðr maðr er vitr. (The knowing man is wise.)

definition: Placing in a horizontal position or thrusting into a particular position.
examples: Lagiðr sverð í steininn. (Thrusting the sword into the stone.)

definition: Having been subjected to the action of fire or heat, resulting in changes in texture, composition, or appearance.
examples: Brenndr skógur eftir eldinn. (The forest burnt after the fire.)

definition: Expressing gratitude or appreciation.
examples: Þakkaðr maðr fyrir góðverk. (A man thanking for a good deed.)

definition: Having residents; occupied by people living there.
examples: Byggðr bær nær fjöllum. (An inhabited village near the mountains.)

definition: Being in the company of someone else; going along with another.
examples: Fylgðr maðr af hundi. (The man accompanied by a dog.)

definition: Having left a vehicle, especially a ship or boat, to go on land; having come to rest at a dock or harbor.
examples: Lendr skip við bryggju. (The ship docked at the pier.)

definition: Having consumed alcohol; indulging in idleness or leisure.
examples: Drukkinn maðr á hátíð. (The drunk man at the festival.)

definition: Having been uttered aloud; expressed in words or song.
examples: Kveðinn ljóð á þingi. (The poem sung at the assembly.)

definition: Having been constructed or set up; having established or created a structure.
examples: Timbraðr turn í borginni. (The tower built in the city.)

definition: Having been caused to die; having been put to death.
examples: Banaðr dreki af hetju. (The dragon slain by the hero.)

definition: Having been guided or controlled in movement or course; having been managed or governed.
examples: Stýrðr bátur á ánni. (The boat steered on the river.)

definition: Having been severely damaged or ruined; having been made desolate.
examples: Eyddr skógur eftir storminn. (The forest devastated after the storm.)

definition: Having been filled or covered with a large amount of something; having been arranged in an orderly pile.
examples: Hlaðinn vagn með heyi. (The wagon loaded with hay.)

definition: Having been provided with a roof; having been overlaid or protected by a covering material.
examples: Þakiðr hús með stráum. (The house roofed with straw.)

definition: Having been traded for something else; having been separated into parts or sections.
examples: Skiptr hlutir milli kaupmanna. (Goods exchanged between merchants.)
Skiptr land í tvo hluta. (The land divided into two parts.)

definition: Having been grasped, acquired, or picked up; having been gathered or retrieved.
examples: Numinn peningur frá borði. (The coin taken from the table.)

definition: Having been elevated or lifted up; having been constructed or assembled.
examples: Reistr höll á hæðinni. (The palace raised on the hill.)

definition: Having been acquired or come into possession of; having been granted or given something.
examples: Getinn heiður fyrir afrek. (The honor obtained for the achievement.)

definition: Having been caused to die; having been put to death or executed.
examples: Drepinn höfðingi í stríði. (The chief killed in war.)

definition: Having been given or granted something; having taken or seized possession of something.
examples: Fenginn arfur frá forfeðrum. (The inheritance received from ancestors.)

definition: Having had revenge taken; having been retaliated against for a wrong or harm done.
examples: Hefnðr föður dauði. (The father's death avenged.)

definition: To grant mercy or forgiveness; to spare someone from harm or punishment.
examples: Hann ákvað að gefa grið þeim óvinum sínum. (He decided to spare his enemies.)

definition: To give oneself up, especially to an opposing force or authority; to concede or submit.
examples: Hann gefr sik ekki. (He does not surrender.)

definition: To support or aid someone; to remain loyal or steadfast.
examples: Hann stendr með vinum sínum. (He stands by his friends.)

definition: In a manner or way that; to the extent or degree that.
examples: Hann hlýðir svá at skilja. (He listens so as to understand.)

definition: Immediately following in time, order, or sequence.
examples: Hann fer heim, þar næst sefur. (He goes home, then sleeps.)

definition: Immediately following in time, order, or sequence.
examples: Hann borðar, því næst sefur. (He eats, then sleeps.)

definition: To accept that someone or something is true, genuine, or trustworthy.
examples: Hann trúar á guð. (He believes in God.)

definition: A mythical tree that plays a central role in Norse cosmology, where it connects the Nine Worlds.
examples: Askr Yggdrasils er miðpunktur heimsins. (The Yggdrasil Ash is the center of the world.)

englishTranslation: set out, embark on a journey
russianTranslation: отправляться в путь, пускаться в путь
definition: To begin a journey or trip; to depart from a place with the intention of traveling.
examples: Hann ætlar að leggja af staði á morgun. (He intends to set out tomorrow.)
